summary: Swissair Flight 111 was a plane traveling from New York to Geneva. On September 2, 1998, it crashed into the Atlantic Ocean near Halifax, Canada. All 229 people on board died. This was the worst accident for Swissair and the second worst in Canada. The cause was a fire that spread quickly due to flammable materials in the plane. The investigation took four years and cost $57 million. New safety rules were made because of what happened.
title: Swissair Flight 111
